=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/r/radiusclient]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures.
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of nagios-plugins.
 0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=radiusclient|CVE]]</nowiki> entries.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=radiusclient|Secunia]]</nowiki> history.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid. 
** No daemons.
** No network activity.
** No source code review.
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package should work out of the box since it is a library.
** No debconf questions asked.
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:radiusclient|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>. No showstoppers.
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/r/radiusclient.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is calm.
** <nowiki>[[http://ftp.cityline.net/pub/radiusclient/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is dead.
** No upstream bug tracker.
** No special hardware needed.
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant.
** <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards compliant.
** Uses debhelper with no patching system
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** debhelper, libtool
** All in main.
